steps.title: Place the whole walnut on an asphalt surface.
steps.content: Place the whole walnut on an asphalt surface. The juices will stain a concrete surface.

steps.title: Stomp on the walnut with your foot and twist the nut into the asphalt surface.
steps.content: Stomp on the walnut with your foot and twist the nut into the asphalt surface. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Pick up the nut and place it in a large pail.
steps.content: Pick up the nut and place it in a large pail.

steps.title: Discard the hulls in the garbage or your compost pile.
steps.content: Discard the hulls in the garbage or your compost pile.

steps.title: Spread your walnuts on a large picnic table or another flat area.
steps.content: Spread your walnuts on a large picnic table or another flat area. Make sure that you are wearing rubber gloves to protect your skin from the juices on the nutshells and that youâ€™re working in an area that you can get dirty.

steps.title: Scrub the exterior of the shells with a wire brush to remove any remaining hull pieces.
steps.content: Scrub the exterior of the shells with a wire brush to remove any remaining hull pieces.

steps.title: Spread the cleaned walnuts in a single layer on a flat surface in a dark, cool, dry and well-ventilated area.
steps.content: Spread the cleaned walnuts in a single layer on a flat surface in a dark, cool, dry and well-ventilated area. Make sure that the surfaces are not touching one another.

steps.title: Cure the walnuts for 5 to 6 weeks.
steps.content: Cure the walnuts for 5 to 6 weeks. If you crack a fresh walnut, then the meat will be rubbery. Curing them allows the kernel to become firm and crunchy. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Soak cured walnuts for 24 hours in hot water.
steps.content: Soak cured walnuts for 24 hours in hot water. This will soften the shell and will make it easier to crack.

steps.title: Remove the walnut from the water.
steps.content: Remove the walnut from the water. Place the walnut on a flat surface with the pointed end facing up.

steps.title: Strike the pointed end with a hammer until the nut cracks along its axis.
steps.content: Strike the pointed end with a hammer until the nut cracks along its axis.

steps.title: Pull the shell apart with your fingers.
steps.content: Pull the shell apart with your fingers.

steps.title: Place the pointed end of a nutpick under the kernel.
steps.content: Place the pointed end of a nutpick under the kernel. Run the nutpick along the edges of the kernel to loosen it from the shell. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place the kernel in a separate bowl.
steps.content: Place the kernel in a separate bowl. Repeat the process until you have shelled all of your walnuts.
